task_summary: Perceive the T-block and target outline, approach and align the circular tool to the block, execute one or more push segments to drive the block into the target T outline, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A stationary manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block until it fits the drawn T target on the table. The robot first perceives both the block and the target, then approaches from a suitable yaw to contact the block’s stem/crossbar. It executes sequential pushes: a longer straight push to translate the piece and a shorter angled push to finish alignment. Finally, it verifies placement and retreats. The sequence runs at 10 Hz observation/control, so actions use moderate timeouts and small tolerances for alignment.
preconditions: Camera calibrated; object and target detectable
stepwise_plan: Detect T-block; if not visible, raster scan and re-detect
Detect target T outline; if not visible, raster scan and re-detect
Move above the block and align precisely for pushing
Set yaw to engage the T crossbar safely
Execute two short pushes to translate toward the target
Fine-align near the target and perform a small finishing push
success_criteria: Block inside the T outline with ≤2 cm translational error
Orientation of block within ≤15° of target orientation
No collisions with table edges or camera boom
failure_and_recovery: Perception fails: raster scan and retry detection (up to 3 attempts)
Misalignment during contact: re-align with ApproachAndAlign and retry push
Insufficient motion due to friction: repeat push cycle
Unexpected contact force: abort push and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when placement criteria are met and the robot has retreated; it fails if perception or push steps exhaust retries/timeouts.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Detect a symbolic target with the vision system.
Perform a scanning motion to facilitate detection.
Move to a pre-push pose above the object.
Descend/slide to contact and align with the target within tolerance.
Rotate the tool yaw to a discrete angle.
Apply a push along a direction for a set distance.
Back off from the workspace after task completion.
Short dwell to stabilize after motions.

failure_modes: Push distance insufficient due to friction
recovery_strategy: Fallback to raster scan then re-detect
Repeat push cycle with same parameters
Retreat and re-approach if unexpected contact occurs
assumptions: Frames show a RED T-block and BLUE target outline; instruction colors (gray/green) differ—frames were trusted.
Primary push direction approximated as 0° (camera +x) followed by a 45° finishing push based on observed motion.
Chosen distances (0.1 m then 0.05 m) reflect coarse then fine translation seen across frames.
Yaw 90° assumed to let the circular tool contact the stem/crossbar safely.

expected_success_criteria: Block enclosed within the outline with small pose error
Robot ends in a safe, retracted pose
